definition.name: NXsts
definition.doc:
Application definition for temperature-dependent IV curve measurements #2023.19.7 This Nexus file is currently only for STS data, it will be updated to handle the STM image mode in the future with a focus on bias spectroscopy in Scanning Tunneling Microscopy.
In this application definition, times should be specified always together with a UTC offset.
This is the application definition describing temperature (T) dependent current voltage (IV) curve measurements. For this, a temperature is set. After reaching the temperature, a voltage sweep is performed. For each voltage, a current is measured. Then, the next desired temperature is set and an IV measurement is performed. The data can be visualized in a tensor with: I (NXsensor_C, NXsoftware_Read_offset, NXcircuit) parameters: V has (NXsource+offset, NXsoftware_Scan_offset, NXsensor_V, NXcircuit) T has (NXsource, NXsoftware_Scan_offset, NXsensor_T) x has (NXsoftware_Scan_offset) y has (NXsoftware_Scan_offset) z has (NXsoftware_Scan_offset)

field.name: experiment_type
field.doc: Name of the experiment where the application is applicable.

field.name: type
field.doc: The equipments and techniques as well as the parameter settings and reference signals are used during the experiments used in Scanning Tunneling Microscopy (STM).

field.name: entry_identifier
field.doc: The name of the output file, with the number of scans at the end. (e.g. 221122_Au_5K00014)

field.name: collection_identifier
field.doc: The name of the series output file, which represents only the public part of the output file. (e.g. 221122_Au_5K)

field.name: experiment_identifier
field.doc: Path to storage of output files. (e.g. Path C:\Users\SPM-PEEM\Desktop\DATA_Nanonis\20220711_CreaTec_Service_Benchmarks_LHe\Nanonis-Session-PMD100-HVHU_CreaTec_Service_PalmaLabBerlin220711)

field.name: experiment_description
field.doc: Descriptive comments for this experiment, added by the experimenter, coming from the output file. (e.g. Comment01 SYNC & Filter LP 8order WITHDRAW 600 steps, locked Au(111), 50pA, 100 mV set point, 1mV DCA, 973Hz,138 1st H, -84 2nd H)

group.name: hardware
group.doc: Hardware type used in SPM experiment, includes hardware manufacturers and type. (e.g. Nanonis BP5e)

group.name: software
group.doc: Type of software used in SPM experiments, such as software version serial number, UI and RT probe release method. (e.g. SW Version Generic 5e -- RT Release 10771)

group.name: current_amplifier
group.doc: The Amplifier description that improves or helps to determine tunnel current (current between tip and bias).

field.name: status
field.doc: Status of Lock-in device whether while performing the experiment

field.name: modulation_signal
field.doc: This is the signal on which the modulation (sine) will be added.

field.name: modulation_frequency
field.doc: The signal is modulated by adding the frequency of the sine modulation. The modulation frequency spans can be from 10 mHz to 40 kHz, corresponding to the output filter cut-off range. When dealing with harmonics, it's essential to ensure that the harmonic frequencies remain below ~100 kHz, which aligns with the input filter cut-off. Be mindful that hardware filters might impact the amplitude as the signal approaches their cut-off frequencies." (e.g. 973E+0)

field.name: modulation_amplitude
field.doc: The amplitude (in physical units of modulated signal) of the sine modulation.

field.name: demodulated_signal
field.doc: The input signal (STS signal) will be demodulated, in order to determine the amplitude and phase at the frequency set in the Frequency field or harmonics, such as current, bias, et.al.

field.name: harmonic_order_N
field.doc: N denotes 1 or 2. The order of the harmonic oscillation to be detected in the demodulated signal should be considered relative to the modulation frequency. When dealing with higher harmonics, it's essential to ensure that their frequencies do not surpass the analogue signal bandwidth (e.g. harmonic_order_1).

field.name: ref_phase_N
field.doc: Reference phase for the sine on the demodulated signal with respect to the modulation signal. The determined phase is displayed with respect to the reference phase.

group.name: sample_bias
group.doc: Bias voltage applied to the sample.

field.name: bias
field.doc: Applied a voltage between tip and sample.

field.name: stm_head_temp
field.doc: Temperature of STM head. Note: At least one field from stm_head_temperature, cryo_bottom_temp and cryo_sheild_temp must be provided.

field.name: cryo_bottom_temp
field.doc: Temperature of liquid helium cryostat. Note: At least one field from stm_head_temperature, cryo_bottom_temp and cryo_sheild_temp must be provided.

field.name: cryo_shield_temp
field.doc: Temperature of liquid nitrogen shield. Temperature 3 (K) (e.g 78.00000E+0). Note: At least one field from stm_head_temperature, cryo_bottom_temp and cryo_sheild_temp must be provided.

group.name: piezo_config
group.doc: Configuration for piezoelectric scanner used to move tip along X and Y direction. The material of the Piezoelectric scanner composed of polycrystalline solids and sensitive to applied voltage.

field.name: active_calib
field.doc: The name of calibration type. (e.g. LHe)

field.name: calib_N
field.doc: N denotes X or Y or Z. There are three parameters in the X, Y, and Z directions, along with three available controls: Calibration (m/V), Range (m), and HV gain. Only two of these parameters are required to define the calibration. Consequently, when any value is changed, one of the other values will be automatically updated. (e.g. calib_X = 3.8E-9)

field.name: hv_gain_N
field.doc: N denotes X or Y or Z. In some systems, there is an HV gain readout feature. For these systems, the HV gain should be automatically adjusted whenever the gain is changed at the high voltage amplifier. (e.g. 14.5)

field.name: tilt_N
field.doc: N denotes X or Y. There are 2 parameters in X and Y directions, and tilt needs to be adjusted according to the actual surface. (in degrees, first order correction).

field.name: curvature_radius_N
field.doc: N denotes X or Y. There are 2 parameters in X and Y directions. (can be set approximately to the length of the piezotube).

field.name: 2nd_order_corr_N
field.doc: N denotes X or Y. There are 2 parameters in X and Y directions. If you know them, you can enter the 2nd order piezo characteristics to compensate for it. The following equation shows the interpretation of the 2nd order correction parameter: For the X-piezo: "Ux = 1/cx · X + cxx · X2" with units: [V] = [V/m] · [m] + [V/m2] · [m2] where cx is the calibration of the piezo X and cxx is the 2nd order correction. (V/m^2). (e.g. 0E+0)

field.name: drift_N
field.doc: N denotes X, Y or Z. There are 3 parameters in X, Y and Z directions. Define the drift speed for all three axes. When the compensation is on, the piezos will start to move at that speed. (e.g. 0E+0)

field.name: drift_correction_status
field.doc: Use the button to enable or disable the drift compensation. (e.g. FALSE)

group.doc: An environmental setup to measure the tunneling current due to different tip- sample biases.

field.name: current
field.doc: This is set-point of tip current (in the constant current mode should be equal to set-point, in the constant height mode means the real tunnelling current between tip and sample).

field.name: current_calibration
field.doc: Value of calibration that comes as A/V. The value for this concept can be read as current per unit voltage.

field.name: x
field.doc: The scanning area in x position in the frame. (e.g. -890.53E-12)

field.name: y
field.doc: The scanning area in y position in the frame. (e.g. 29.6968E-9)

field.name: z
field.doc: The scanning area in z position in the frame. (e.g. 130.5E-9)

field.name: z
field.doc: Indicate the relative tip position z between tip and sample. The tip position can also be varied when the z_controller is not running. (e.g. 130.5E-9)

field.name: integration_time
field.doc: Time during which the spectroscopy data are acquired and averaged. (e.g. 150E-6)

field.name: number_of_sweeps
field.doc: Number of sweeps to measure and average. (e.g. 100)

field.name: sweep_start
field.doc: The start bias values of the sweep. (e.g. -300E-3)

field.name: sweep_end
field.doc: The end bias values of the sweep. (e.g. 300E-3)

field.name: num_pixel
field.doc: The sweep number of points is defined as the maximum spectrum resolution, which is equal to the bias sweep window divided by the number of pixels. (e.g. 4096)

field.name: z_avg_time
field.doc: The Z position is recorded and averaged for a certain duration both before and after the sweep. After the initial Z averaging time, if "Z-Controller to Hold" is selected, the Z-Controller is set to hold mode, and the tip is positioned at the previously averaged Z position (adjusted by the Z offset). (e.g. 100E-3)

field.name: rt_frequency
field.doc: The bandwidth of the Hardware and/or Software is instrument specific. For example, Nanonis Generic 5 has 'RT Frequency' (e.g. 20E+3).

field.name: signals_oversampling
field.doc: The Signals Period represents the rate at which signals are transferred to the host computer, which operates the control software. This rate may be 10 times lower than the sampling rate, as the real-time engine internally oversamples the signal. If desired, you may have the option to reduce the oversampling to 1, enabling higher frequency resolution in the Spectrum Analyzer. (e.g. 10)

field.name: acquisition_period
field.doc: The update rate is utilized in various processes, including the History Graph, Auto-Approach, and multiple Programming Interface functions. It may be configured to a 20 ms interval. Any additional timings must strictly be integer multiples of this base value. While it is possible to set these additional timings to different values, the actual timing value will automatically be adjusted to become a multiple of the Acquisition Period. (e.g. 20E-3)

field.name: animations_period
field.doc: The update rate of animated graphical indicators, such as graphs and sliders, can be adjusted. A normal value may be 40 ms, which corresponds to 25 updates per second. Increasing this period can help reduce the processor load on the graphical user interface, particularly on slower computers. It is important to note that this update rate solely impacts the user interface and does not affect measurements in any manner. (e.g. 20E-3)

field.name: indicators_period
field.doc: The update rate of digital indicators, such as the numbers displayed, can be set to 3 updates per second, equivalent to 300 ms. This interval is sufficient for the user interface and does not impact measurements in any manner. (e.g. 300E-3)

field.name: measurements_period
field.doc: The Measurements period determines the integration time required for precise measurements, primarily utilized in sweep modules. It is particularly useful for tasks such as recording force-distance curves or cantilever resonances. For swift measurements with small steps, a value of 40 ms is often adequate. For regular use, a range of 300-500 ms may be recommended, but when capturing the resonance of a high-Q cantilever, longer values in the range of several seconds might be necessary. Usually, this parameter does not require manual adjustment within this module, as the sweep modules automatically set this value according to the sweep timings. (e.g. 500E-3)

field.name: scan_range
field.doc: In STM experiment, the scan range is the coordinate (x,y) along the X and Y axis from the origin (scan_offset) of the scan area (e.g. 5.000000E-9 5.000000E-9).

field.name: scan_offset
field.doc: In STM experiment, the scan offset is the position of the tip at the starting point of scan area. (e.g. -2.354637E-7 1.267476E-)

field.name: scan_direction
field.doc: In STM experiment, the scan direction is the direction from which side of the sample the tip starts scanning.

field.name: scan_angle
field.doc: The angle of scan with the bottom or top side (depends on the scan_direction field) of the sample. (e.g. 0.000E+0).

field.name: frame
field.doc: Also clarify the frame for the ROI of the scan in lab frame, the middle of the lab frame is (0, 0), and positive in x means right and in y means up.

field.name: channels_current
field.doc: The scan channels are selected by users. (e.g. (A);Bias (V);Z (m);LI Demod 2 X (A);LI Demod 2 Y (A);LI Demod 1 X (A);LI Demod 1 Y (A))

field.name: scanfield
field.doc: Configure the scan frame like x position; y position; width; height. (e.g. 3.11737E-9;29.1583E-9;15E-9;15E-9;0E+0). If the 'scanfield' is not considered, use the 'scan_range' and 'scan_offset' from 'scan_control' group

field.name: pixels_line
field.doc: Scan resolution by setting the Lines equal to Pixels. (e.g. 512)

field.name: lines
field.doc: Define the image resolution. (e.g. 512)

field.name: speed_forw
field.doc: Define the scan forward speed in the forward direction. (m/s) (e.g. 11.7187E-9)

field.name: speed_backw
field.doc: Define the scan backward speed in the forward direction. (m/s) (e.g. 11.7187E-9)

group.name: sample
group.doc: This describes the sample and its properties, as well as constraints that are applied to the sample before scanning.

field.name: sample_prep_descripton
field.doc: At this moment no base class available that can track entire sample preparation.

group.doc: This NXdata should contain separate fields for the current values at different temperature setpoints, for example current_at_100C. There should also be two more fields called temperature and voltage containing the setpoint values. There should also be a field with an array of rank equal to the number of different temperature setpoints and each child's dimension equal to the number of voltage setpoints. axes: bias_calc signals: li_demod_[1;2]_[X/Y]_[-;bwd;filt;bwd_filt] current_[-;bwd;filt;bwd_filt] temperature

group.name: single_point
group.doc: Plot for a single point (x,y) with I vs. V curve.

group.name: line_scan
group.doc: Line scan with multiple I vs. V curves for different single (x,y) co-ordinates.

group.name: alternative_plot
group.doc: Plot for current(I) curve in the 2D space of (position(x), bias(V)) which can be derived from the `line_scan` plot.

group.name: mesh_scan
group.doc: Mesh scan with 2D slices of the above alternative plot for other y co-ordinates.
